course.title: Biopolitics and Vampire Aesthetics, 1750-2015
course.description: This course traces the infamous bloodsucker's bite-marks through European literature from the 18th to the 21st century, exploring how the notion of vampirism is inextricably linked with the emergence of what Michel Foucault has termed `biopolitics'. How do the `body politic' and a vampiric aesthetics mutually condition each other? We pursue this question by engaging in a dialogue between literature, film, science, and critical theory. Authors include Goethe, Byron, Hoffmann, Baudelaire, Stoker, Nietzsche, Doblin, Tawada.
